metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1612 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
The LoadIC::UpdateCaches function in ic/ic.cc in Google V8, as used inGoogle Chrome before 48.0.2564.82, does not ensure receiver compatibilitybefore performing a cast of an unspecified variable, which allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have unknown otherimpact via crafted JavaScript code.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1612` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 48.0.2564.82-0ubuntu1.1222
chromium-browser-l10n - 48.0.2564.82-0ubuntu1.1222
chromium-chromedriver - 48.0.2564.82-0ubuntu1.1222
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 48.0.2564.82-0ubuntu1.1222
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 48.0.2564.82-0ubuntu1.1222
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '48.0.2564.82-0ubuntu1.1222').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
